description: Newcastle 1-2 Brighton (aet): Seagulls keep trophy dream alive
title: Newcastle 1-2 Brighton (aet): Seagulls keep trophy dream alive
title_page: Newcastle 1-2 Brighton (aet): Seagulls keep trophy dream alive - BBC Sport
maintext:
Brighton and Newcastle are both teams for whom winning the FA Cup would mean the world to their fans.
Newcastle, battling with Brighton in the league for the European places, would have been targeting this as a chance to win a first trophy since the 1969 Inter-Cities Fairs Cup.
They have a big chance to end that drought later this month – when they play Liverpool in the Carabao Cup final on Sunday, 16 March.
But they will have to take on that game without key forward Gordon, who was sent off for a completely unnecessary clash with Jan Paul van Hecke. The England international laughed at the Brighton defender lying on the ground – before seeing the red card come out.
To make matters worse, the incident happened after Alexander Isak was in an offside position so nothing that happened would have counted – except violent conduct.
